marketNews.title: Indonesia Consumer Price Index (CPI) 1.57% YoY in 2024, Lowest Since Record
marketNews.content:
Indonesia's consumer price index (CPI) slowed to 1.57 percent year-on-year in December 2024, according to the Statistics Agency (BPS). This was down from 1.55 percent YoY in November 2024 and below the consensus forecast of 1.6 percent YoY, marking the lowest calendar-year inflation since BPS began publishing inflation data in 1958. The realization is within the lower bound of Bank Indonesia’s target range of 1.5-3.5 percent.

The low annual inflation in 2024 was driven by price declines in several commodities, including red chili, bird’s eye chili, green chili, gasoline, air-transport fares, and mobile telephone services. Core inflation in December 2024 was 2.26 percent YoY, also lower than the consensus expectation of 2.28 percent YoY.

On a month-to-month basis, Indonesia recorded CPI inflation of 0.44 percent in December 2024, up from 0.30 percent in November 2024, matching expectations and representing the highest monthly increase in the past nine months. The monthly rise was led by the food, beverage and tobacco group, which posted 1.33 percent MoM inflation, contributing 0.38 percentage point to the overall CPI. Core CPI rose 0.17 percent MoM, unchanged from November 2024.

On the same day the inflation data were released, S&P Global reported that Indonesia’s manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) stood at 51.2 in December 2024, up from 49.6 in November 2024, indicating the first expansionary reading since June 2024 as output grew moderately.

Industrial Ministry spokesperson Febri Hendri Antoni Arif said that the introduction of a 12 percent value-added tax (VAT) in January 2025 prompted manufacturers to increase orders for inventory, helping the manufacturing PMI to enter expansion territory. He added that firms were trying to take advantage of the window before the VAT increase, although the government later revised the regulation to apply only to luxury goods.

marketNews.title: Constitutional Court Removes Presidential Threshold
marketNews.content: The Constitutional Court on Thursday, 2 January 2025, annulled the presidential threshold provision (Article 222 of Law No. 7/2017 on elections), stating that the threshold violated citizens’ political rights, sovereignty, morality, rationality and fairness. The court’s decision removes the requirement that political parties must hold a certain percentage of seats to nominate presidential and vice-presidential candidates, thereby allowing any registered party to put forward a presidential candidate, opening the field to alternative candidates outside large coalitions.

marketNews.title: Export Copper Concentrate Ban Continues
marketNews.content: The Director of the Ministry of Trade, Andri Gilang Nugraha, said the government will continue the ban on copper concentrate exports effective 1 January 2025, as stipulated in Ministerial Regulation No. 10/2024. Meanwhile, the Director of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Julian Ambassadur Shiddiq, indicated that no guidance has been issued regarding a relaxation of the copper concentrate export ban for PT Freeport Indonesia, and that any extension would require presidential approval. PT Freeport Indonesia had previously sought a relaxation following a fire at its smelter in JIIPE, Gresik, in October 2024.

marketNews.title: Biodiesel B40 Transition Period
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Yuliot Tanjung, told Reuters on Friday, 3 January 2025, that Indonesian firms will receive a transition period of 1.5 months starting 1 January 2025 to comply with the B40 biodiesel blend requirement. He added that the government will soon issue technical regulations for B40 implementation, though the exact release date was not disclosed. The B40 mandate was originally scheduled to take effect on 1 January 2025, but fuel retailers and biodiesel producers have been unable to sign distribution contracts without the technical rules. Tanjung also reaffirmed the government’s plan to allocate 15.6 million kiloliters of biodiesel this year.

marketNews.title: Increase in DHE SDA Foreign-Exchange Allocation
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the government will increase the share and tenor of foreign-exchange proceeds from natural-resource export (DHE SDA) placement, raising the minimum from 30 percent for three months to 50 percent for six to twelve months. In exchange, banks will be required to offer a high interest rate of up to 4.48 percent on the DHE SDA funds. The revision of the DHE SDA regulation is expected to be released at the end of January 2025. Reuters had first reported the possible revision in November 2024, noting that the change aims to boost foreign-exchange reserves and ensure domestic availability of foreign currency.

marketNews.title: Apple Investment Announcement
marketNews.content: Investment and Decarbonization Minister Rosan Roeslani said that the confirmation of Apple Inc.’s (NASDAQ: AAPL) investment in Indonesia will be announced on 7 January 2025. Previously, Rosan indicated that Apple is committed to invest US$1 billion in Indonesia. The investment proposal was submitted after the Indonesian government prohibited the sale of iPhone 16 models that do not meet the 40 percent local content (TKDN) requirement.

marketNews.title: Ceramic Industry Utilization Increase
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association, Edy Suyanto, stated that the utilization rate of ceramic production rose from 67 percent in October 2024 to 75 percent in November-December 2024, following the implementation of anti-dumping duties and the mandatory Indonesian National Standard for ceramics. For 2025, companies aim to increase average utilization to 80 percent, considering the government’s program to build three million houses per year and the latest VAT regulations.

marketNews.title: Free Nutrition Program Launch
marketNews.content: The Head of the Legal and Public Relations Bureau of the National Nutrition Agency, Lalu Muhammad Iwan Mahardan, announced that a free nutritious meal program will be launched on Monday, 6 January 2025. The initial phase targets three million beneficiaries, including children, pregnant women, and nursing mothers.

marketNews.title: BEI to Launch Foreign Index Futures
marketNews.content: The President Director of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, Iman Rachman, said the exchange will launch a new derivative product called a foreign index futures contract in mid-January 2025. Initially, the exchange will list a futures contract on the MSCI Hong Kong Large-Cap Index (code MSLCHKMY), expected to start trading no later than the first quarter of 2025. Iman also indicated that futures on the Hang Seng and Nikkei indices will be introduced later, pending licensing agreements. With the addition of new derivative products, the exchange hopes to attract more members to participate in derivatives, noting that currently only three members hold derivative licenses.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Consolidation of Garuda Indonesia, Pelita Air Service and Citilink Targeted to Complete Within 6 Months
tickerNews.content: Minister of State-Owned Enterprises Erick Thohir said that the consolidation of Garuda Indonesia, PT Pelita Air Service, and PT Citilink Indonesia is targeted to be completed within the next six months. The consolidation plan was first presented by Erick in August 2023 to reduce logistics costs. In September 2023, Erick mentioned that Pelita Air would merge with Citilink – a GIAA subsidiary – by the end of 2023 or early 2024, while GIAA would remain a separate entity. In a separate statement, GIAA’s Commercial Director Ade R. Susardi said GIAA aims to add 20 new aircraft to its fleet in 2025, comprising roughly 15-16 Boeing planes and the remainder Airbus. As of the end of September 2024, GIAA operated 61 aircraft.

tickerNews.title: TCPI Plans Private Placement of Up to 500 Million New Shares at Approx 6,288 IDR per Share, Dilution Up to 9.1%
tickerNews.content: Transcoal Pacific plans to conduct a private placement of up to approximately 500 million new shares, with an estimated issue price of 6,288 Indonesian rupiah per share, resulting in a dilution effect of up to 9.1 percent. The identity of prospective investors and the intended use of the proceeds have not been disclosed. The plan will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on 6 January 2025.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Targets Low Single-Digit Revenue and Net Profit Growth in 2025
tickerNews.content: SIDO’s President Director David Hidayat said the company targets low single-digit growth in revenue and net profit for 2025. To achieve this, SIDO plans to launch new herbal-based products, increase domestic market penetration, and expand export contributions. SIDO has budgeted capital expenditures of roughly 150-175 billion rupiah for 2025, compared with an allocation of 150-200 billion rupiah in 2024, aimed at maintaining production facilities and developing technology. For 2024 performance, David is optimistic that SIDO will achieve an annual net profit increase of more than 10 percent year-on-year.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Aims New Contract Value 25-28 Trillion IDR in 2025, Down 25-33% from 2024 Target
tickerNews.content: ADHI’s Company Secretary Rozi Sparta said the company targets new contract values of about 25-28 trillion rupiah in 2025, which is 25-33 percent lower than the 2024 target of 37.4 trillion rupiah. Meanwhile, ADHI’s President Director Entus Asnawi Mukhson reported that ADHI recorded new contract values of 20 trillion rupiah in 2024, a 46.5 percent decline year-on-year from the 2023 realization of 37.4 trillion rupiah, achieving only 53.5 percent of the 2024 target.

tickerNews.title: SKRN Divests 70% Stake in PT Gunanusa Utama Fabricator to PT Saga Investama Sedaya for 168 Billion IDR
tickerNews.content: Superkrane Mitra Utama announced the divestiture of its entire 70 percent stake in the subsidiary PT Gunanusa Utama Fabricator to the controlling shareholder PT Saga Investama Sedaya. The transaction value totals 168 billion rupiah and is intended to strengthen the company’s working capital for expanding its crane fleet.

tickerNews.title: TRIS Shares Purchased by PT Southern Cross Textile Industries, 703 Million Shares at 50 IDR Each, Ownership Increases to 9.99%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Trisula Textile Industries, PT Southern Cross Textile Industries, purchased 703 million TRIS shares at 50 rupiah per share on 27 December 2024, amounting to roughly 35.2 billion rupiah. After the transaction, PT Southern Cross Textile Industries’ ownership in TRIS increased from 0.3 percent to 9.99 percent.

tickerNews.title: KDTN Takes Over Swiss-Belexpress Rest Area km 19 on Cikampek Toll Road, Rebranded as Kedaton 8 Xpress
tickerNews.content: Puri Sentul Permai announced that it has taken over the operation of the Swiss-Belexpress Rest Area at kilometer 19 on the Cikampek Toll Road from Swiss-Belhotel International as of 1 January 2025. Following the takeover, the rest area has been rebranded as Kedaton 8 Xpress.
